you made this so easy to understand!! thank you
I don't understand the first part where you said if acceleration is negative the velocity is decreasing. Velocity is also negative in the question. So won't it make the velocity increasing ?
Can you create a video on place value and total value. I hope it will not take you too long to do it. I need it because I prefer your explanations.

As long as the acceleration is positive or negative, the velocity will always correspond to the sign of the acceleration. Velocity is negative (because of acceleration) so that means it's decreasing in this problem. if V and A are both negative or both positive then that means the "car" is "speeding up" because they're both approaching -infinity or +infinity.

Hes pointing out the problem (a), its about the number so -a makes the velocity decreasing and vice versa. I think u telling about the part (b) thats another case since concept is about change of speed
